title: Viasat completes first broadband upgrade on military sealift fleet
summary: The company plans to upgrade 105 ships under a 2022 agreement with the Military Sealift Command

title: Uruguay signs Artemis Accords
summary: Uruguay signed the Artemis Accords outlining best practices in space exploration Feb. 15, the second country in as many weeks to do so.

title: India targets a surge in civil and commercial launches
summary: India is planning up to 30 launches over a 15-months period, indicating the ambition for a significant rise in both civil and commercial launch activities.

title: Has the RFA ONE Maiden Flight Slipped to Q4 2024?
summary:
German launch startup Rocket Factory Augsburg has stated that it is preparing for the maiden flight of its RFA ONE rocket in the second quarter of 2024. However, the flight appears to have slipped to the fourth quarter of this year. RFA will be launching the maiden flight of RFA ONE from SaxaVord, a spaceport […]
The post Has the RFA ONE Maiden Flight Slipped to Q4 2024? appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Iridium adds five years to constellation lifetime estimate
summary: Iridium Communications expects to get another five years out of its satellites, pushing out any need to complete a replenishment of the L-band connectivity constellation to at least 2035.
